intro: Hibbertia vestita var. genuina, commonly known as the Narrow-leafed Sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open woodlands and heathlands. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are woody and branched. Hibbertia vestita var. genuina is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late autumn to early spring.
